intro: Blepharis pratensis, commonly known as the common blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is often found in disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and they bloom from late winter to early summer. Blepharis pratensis is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
